title: A Comparative Study on Textual Saliency of Styles from Eye Tracking, Annotations, and Language Models. (arXiv:2212.09873v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: There is growing interest in incorporating eye-tracking data and other implicit measures of human language processing into natural language processing (NLP) pipelines. The data from human language processing contain unique insight into human linguistic understanding that could be exploited by language models. However, many unanswered questions remain about the nature of this data and how it can best be utilized in downstream NLP tasks. In this paper, we present eyeStyliency, an eye-tracking dataset for human processing of stylistic text (e.g., politeness). We develop a variety of methods to derive style saliency scores over text using the collected eye dataset. We further investigate how this saliency data compares to both human annotation methods and model-based interpretability metrics. translated_title: 眼动数据、注释和语言模型的文本显著性风格的比较研究
translated_abstract: 近年来，将眼动数据和其他人类语言处理的隐式测量方法引入自然语言处理（NLP）流程日益受到关注。人类语言处理数据中蕴含了对人类语言理解独特的洞察力，可以被语言模型所利用。然而，关于这些数据的性质以及如何在下游NLP任务中最好地利用它们仍然存在许多未解答的问题。在本文中，我们介绍了eyeStyliency，一个用于研究人类对文体文本（如礼貌性）进行处理的眼动数据集。我们开发了多种方法，利用收集的眼动数据对文本进行风格显著性评分。我们进一步研究了这种显著性数据与人类注释方法和基于模型的解释性指标的比较。我们发现，虽然眼动数据很独特，但它与人类注释和基于模型的重要性评分交集，为人类和机器之间的视角提供了可能的桥梁。
tldr: 本研究比较了眼动数据、注释和语言模型对文本风格的显著性的影响，发现眼动数据在人类注释和基于模型的评分中起到了桥梁的作用。
en_tdlr: This study compares the impact of eye-tracking data, annotations, and language models on the saliency of textual styles, finding that eye-tracking data serves as a bridge between human annotations and model-based scores.
